claim: Flublok is produced using a novel production platform in which recombinant HA is expressed in insect cells using a baculovirus expression vector system (BEVS).

verified_evidence.quote:
It contains purified ha proteins produced in a continuous insect cell line (expresSF+®) that is derived rom Sf9 cells of the fall army worm, Spodoptera frug i per da (which is related to moths, caterpillars and butterflies), and grown in serum free medium composed of chemically- defined lipids, vitamins, amino acids, and mineral salts. Each of the three HAs is d ihi ll li i b l i (A hlif i l

expressed in this cell line using abaculo virus vector (Autograph a cali for nica nuclear polyhedrosis virus), extracted from the cells with Triton X-100 and further purified by column chromatography.

The wording is nearly identical, with only minor typographical and formatting differences due to line breaks and OCR errors.. The quote directly supports the claim. This is a clear description of the baculovirus expression vector system (BEVS), confirming the claim that Flublok is produced using a novel platform where recombinant HA is expressed in insect cells using BEVS.
